about_the_game:
Do you enjoy playing around with the physics in games? Then this is the game for you. Stack Masters is built around exploring that concept in a competitive way. Including a built in level editor and Steam Workshop support, the game offers a never ending supply of physics sandbox gameplay to explore.

Compete to build crazy structures in order to climb the leaderboards or simply work your way through over 100 levels to beat the campaign.


A low price was always the plan but that does not mean low quality.

We want you to be able to buy the game whenever you want, without needing to wait for a sale, or to grab a bunch of copies and share them with friends so you can all compete for the top spot on the leaderboards.



However you choose to play the game, we want you to play the game, and didn't want price to ever be an issue.

Oh, and don't worry, there are no microtransations either.



Nope, far from it. The game is split into different categories each exploring a different game mechanic or theme.



You'll start with the simplest of towers, but you'll soon be dealing with drop zones, time manipulation, logic puzzles, gravity sliders, multi-zones, pivot blocks, ungrabbable blocks, interlocking blocks, bridges, weights and even a level built to play like a pachinko machine.

There are over one hundred levels already and we've only just begun to scratch the surface of what's possible.

Better yet, everyone can explore those possibilities with an in-game level editor. See below for details.


Play together with children to teach them the basics of physics, or use your engineering degree to push things to the extreme.

Every category contains a selection of levels, from easy to hard, to allow everyone to explore the whole game.



You only need to beat one or two levels in each category to unlock the next, which allows players from all skill levels to easily progress through the game and explore the different themes and game mechanics.

Most levels are designed to be solvable in anything from five to thirty minutes but if you want to compete for the best possible scores you can expect to spend hours on each level in order to find the ultimate solution.


Each level can have up to three leaderboards, allowing you to compete with your Steam friends or push yourself towards a world record for ultimate glory.


Every level was built using the game's super easy to use level editor. A single click of a button can allow you to begin editing the level you are currently playing or to start a brand new one from scratch.

Choose an arena, choose a location, choose from hundreds of block shapes, drag and drop them wherever you like, and start playing your creation instantly right there in the editor. A couple of clicks and you've added a new goal zone. A couple of drags and you resized and moved it to the perfect position.

Want a new wall here or there? No problem. Click click.
Want a drop zone here, or to change a block to a different type? No problem. Click click.



Once done, you can share your levels instantly via the Steam Workshop.


Two clicks is all it takes to upload your creations, and one click to download each new community created level you want to play. It couldn't be easier.




Have you got what it takes to become the next Stack Master?

name: Stack Masters

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS *: Windows 7 \ 8 \ 10 \ 11 (64bit)
  • Processor: 2 Ghz Dual Core
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Intel HD 4600 or better.
  • Network: Broadband Internet connection
  • Storage: 2 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system

Including a built in level editor and Steam Workshop support, the game offers a never ending supply of physics sandbox gameplay to explore.
